1115648953364701185.text: And breaking the internet into smaller, more governable chunks means 1. we will see how different regulatory approaches play out and 2. increase the opportunities for local innovators and startups that would otherwise be choked out by global platforms

1115648485225897984.text: Everyone already experiences a regional internet because of algorithms that relentlessly track your location, I feel no remorse about Google and Facebook having to pay more money to fit within the law in every country they operate in

1115648017141510145.text: My hottest take after "terms of service agreements should be illegal" is "it's probably a good thing if the internet splinters into multiple regional subnets because of regulation"https://www.theverge.com/interface/2019/4/9/18301330/uk-online-harms-white-paper-dcms-regulation-free-speech …
